title: following order, with respect to which, pursuant to subsection (4) of that section,
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 

2022 (Section 4(2)) (Scheme Termination Date) Order 2025.
text_norm: 1 order may cited civil law (miscellaneous provisions) act 2022 (section 4(2)) (scheme termination date) order 2025

title: following order, with respect to which, pursuant to subsection (4) of that section,
heading: 2. The date referred to in the definition of “scheme termination date” in
text_raw:
2. The date referred to in the definition of “scheme termination date” in 
section 4(1) of the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022 (No. 19 of 
2022) shall be 31 March 2026. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 March, 2025. 

NORMA FOLEY, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st April, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [96] 3

title: following order, with respect to which, pursuant to subsection (4) of that section,
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022 to extend 
the scheme termination date for the financial contribution for hosting temporary 
protection beneficiaries to 31 March 2026. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [96]
